intro: Astragalus mattam, commonly known as the Indian milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Pakistan, Afghanistan, and India. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with compound leaves and yellow or pale yellow pea-like flowers. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions. Astragalus mattam is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional systems of medicine.
